state.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the physical or mental condition that someone or something is in
state.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: She was in an extremely confused state of mind.
She can’t go home now. Look at the state of her!
The country was in a state of war (=officially fighting a war).
Water exists in three states: liquid, gaseous, and solid.
When we bought the house, it was in a terrible state.
Frankly, I wouldn’t trust his emotional state right now.
David’s in no fit state to drive.
in no fit state to do something
The boat was in a good state of repair.
be in a good/bad state of repair
There are fears for the state of the country’s economy.
state.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: the government or political organization of a country
state.translation[0].definitions[1].note: matters/affairs of state (=the business of the government)
state.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The state has allocated special funds for the emergency.
limits on salary increases for state workers
state.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a country considered as a political organization
state.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: a NATO member state (=a country belonging to NATO)
state.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: one of the areas with limited law-making powers that together make up a country controlled by a central government, such as the US and Australia
state.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Queensland is one of the states of Australia.
state.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: the official ceremonies and events connected with government or rulers
state.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: the Queen’s first state visit here in 17 years
music for state occasions (=special public events)
state.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 1: the physical or mental condition that someone or something is in
state.translation[0].note_box[0].section: a bad state
The report commented on the poor state of the roads.
a terrible state
His apartment was in a terrible state.
a healthy state
Student numbers at the college are in a healthy state.
somebody’s mental/emotional state
Whenever Ben stops his medication, his mental state deteriorates.
somebody’s physical state
Our emotions can have an effect on our physical state.
something’s natural state
There's a plan to return large areas of farmland to their natural state.
something’s present/current state
We can deduce how the planet evolved from its beginnings to its present state.
a constant/permanent/perpetual state of something
They lived in a constant state of fear.
an advanced state of something
The dead bird was in an advanced state of decay.
somebody’s state of mind
What was his state of mind at the time of the attack?
somebody’s state of health
The doctor said my general state of health was good.
something’s state of repair/preservation
School buildings should be kept in a good state of repair.
a state of shock/confusion/panic etc
Howard, still in a state of shock, stared at Newman.
a state of collapse
The economy was in a state of collapse.
a state of war
Syria was still in a state of war with Israel.
the present/current state of knowledge
That is the best advice we can offer, given our current state of knowledge about the disease.
state.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: – Meaning 3: a country considered as a political organization
state.translation[0].note_box[1].section: Croatia became an independent state in 1991.

Until recently, the country was a one-party state.

state.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to formally say or write a piece of information or your opinion
state.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Please state your name and address.

The government needs to clearly state its policy on UN intervention.

state.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if a document, newspaper, ticket etc states information, it contains the information written clearly
state.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The price of the tickets is stated on the back.
state.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the condition that someone or something is in at a particular time
state.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: The property market is in a poor state.

state.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: one of the areas with limited law-making powers that some countries, such as the US, are divided into
state.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: New York State has attracted more foreign companies than any other state.
